channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump's outrageous refusal to lead is making the pandemic worse
Revolutionary vaccine enters second round of human trials
item.description: Imperial College's vaccine trial volunteers are entering the second round of human trials. CNN's Nina dos Santos reports.

item.title: Even Donald Trump knows he is in deep, deep trouble
item.description: During his rambling speech in the Rose Garden Tuesday, President Donald Trump pushed back on the idea that his campaign was flailing.

item.title: Ivanka Trump's alternative universe
item.description: In a week that has seen the President's daughter hawk beans on her social media account, and unveil a jobs assistance program in the midst of a global pandemic with the awkward moniker of "Find Something New," Ivanka Trump once again finds herself in the middle of a heap of criticism.

item.title: US reports more than 77,000 new Covid-19 cases in highest daily spike
See meeting abruptly end after turning into anti-mask protest
item.description: Utah County Commission Chair, Tanner Ainge, had to shut down an overcrowded meeting when the crowd erupted into an anti-mask protest after the discussion turned to face mask mandates in schools.

item.title: Does our blood type make us more vulnerable to Covid-19?
item.description: Most humans fall into one of four blood groups â€” A, B, AB or O.

item.title: India's coronavirus cases surge past one million
A teen on her first skydive and a veteran instructor died when their chutes failed
item.description: Jeanna Triplicata wasn't a thrill-seeker, but she decided to try something daring after graduating high school: going skydiving for the first time.

item.title: Don Lemon is still in disbelief at this Trump quote
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon wonders how anyone believes Donald Trump, saying that the President's own words about downplaying the Covid-19 pandemic should tell people everything they need to know.

item.title: Before taking her own life, triathlete asked mother to 'lay bare the sins' of alleged abusers
item.description: He's a typically proud father as he recalls the joy of his daughter winning a medal.

item.title: Five-year-old boy allegedly raped by group of children on remote Australian beach
item.description: A five-year-old boy was allegedly raped by three children in northern Australia earlier this month, police said.

item.title: US Navy aircraft carriers resume rare dual exercises in the South China Sea
item.description: Two US Navy aircraft carriers have resumed rare dual exercises in the South China Sea, the second time this month the massive warships have teamed up in the contested waters.

item.title: UN aid chief to wealthy nations: 'Failure to act now will leave the virus free to circle round the globe'
item.description: The United Nations' top official in charge of humanitarian aid has criticized the world's wealthy industrialized nations for their "short sighted" response to the Covid-19 pandemic, warning that their failure to support the developing world could exacerbate the effects of the global health crisis for tens of millions of people.

item.title: Trump puts his China trade deal above all else. It's making his Beijing strategy a mess
Rand Paul has wildly irresponsible ideas about a future vaccine
item.description: Rand Paul is a Republican senator from Kentucky. He is also a doctor.

item.title: Dr. Gupta's tips for hosting a BBQ during a pandemic
item.description: With many traditional summer activities affected by the coronavirus pandemic, CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta demonstrates how to safely host a backyard BBQ.

item.title: At least 15 women are accusing Washington Redskins staffers of sexual harassment, report says
item.description: The Washington Redskins have launched an internal investigation after 15 former female employees and two journalists who covered the team accused team staffers of sexual harassment and verbal abuse, the team told CNN.

item.title: Her husband strangled her. Then her country locked down and now she's forced to live with him
item.description: Activists in Mexico say lockdown measures put in place to slow the spread of Covid-19 lead to an uptick in domestic violence, especially against women. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.

item.title: CEO's dismemberment sends shock waves through Nigeria's tech community
A nightmare scenario for farmers is happening right now
item.description: In early July, farmer Jeremy Storey dropped off an order of eggs at a restaurant's back door as planned and continued on his way.

item.title: CNN anchor: Pence got one thing right in his Covid-19 op-ed
item.description: As coronavirus surges across most of the US, CNN's Jake Tapper revisits Vice President Mike Pence's Wall Street Journal op-ed where he lauded the Trump administration's response to the pandemic and credited the president's leadership for its success.

item.title: 'Europe's last dictator' causes alarm at US State Department
item.description: The State Department expressed concern at crackdowns on protesters and journalists after two candidates opposing that country's leader -- nicknamed "Europe's last dictator" -- were disqualified from the race.

item.title: Vogue's first Black editor-in-chief says he was racially profiled on his way into work
item.description: British Vogue's editor Edward Enninful said he was racially profiled on the way into work, with a security guard instructing him to enter the magazine's premises via the loading dock.

item.title: Closest ever images of sun reveal something scientists had never seen
item.description: Our sun was ready for its close-up last month, and the new Solar Orbiter mission captured the closest images ever taken of the sun during its first pass. The images were released on Thursday.

item.title: GOP state rep. claims Florida is doing 'just fine.' See CNN anchor read the stunning data to him
item.description: Florida Republican state lawmaker Rep. Anthony Sabatini, who has filed numerous lawsuits to prevent mask mandates in his state, tells CNN's Brianna Keilar that his state is doing just fine despite data showing Florida is a hotspot for coronavirus.

item.title: US has 'several' indications Iran has put portions of air defense on high alert
item.description: The US has "several" intelligence indications that Iran has put portions of its air defense system on "high alert" in recent days, following unexplained explosions at key facilities tied to the country's military and nuclear programs, according to a US official who is closely tracking developments.

item.title: Will Trump try to self-pardon?
item.description: President Donald Trump has used his pardon power sparingly, but overwhelmingly to benefit his friends and to protect his own interests. Former George W. Bush Administration official Jack Goldsmith recently analyzed Trump's pardons for Lawfare and concluded that "no president in American history comes close to matching Trump's systematically self-serving use of the pardon power."

item.title: One woman, four men, a tiny boat and a hungry polar bear
item.description: The summer before I turned 40 -- with my fertility ebbing, as everyone with a vested interest in such things felt the need to remind me -- I decided to set sail on the biggest adventure of my life.

item.title: How New Zealand became the apocalypse bunker of the world
item.description: In Queenstown â€” a picturesque ski spot that often attracts comparisons to Aspen, Colorado â€” rumors about foreigners investing in apocalypse-proof bunkers have been swirling for years.

item.title: Footage shows ships damaged by fire at Iranian port city
item.description: A fire has damaged at least seven vessels in a port city in Iran, acording to state media. Just two weeks after a fire at a nuclear complex, it's the latest in a series of mysterious incidents at key locations around the country. CNN's Jomana Karadsheh reports.

item.title: Mary Trump's book breaks record with mammoth sales
item.description: Mary Trump's tell-all book had sold a staggering 950,000 copies by the end of its first day on sale, publisher Simon & Schuster said Thursday.

item.title: Bacteria that eats metal accidentally discovered by scientists
item.description: Scientists have discovered a type of bacteria that eats and gets its calories from metal, after suspecting they exist for more than a hundred years but never proving it.

item.title: Pentagon reveals some details of Trump's 'super duper' missile
item.description: Defense officials have revealed to CNN details about the hypersonic missile President Donald Trump has long touted as a "super duper" new military weapon -- part of a major effort to catch up to Russian and Chinese hypersonic weapons programs.

item.title: The world loves the US dollar. Trump and the pandemic could change that
Teen reels in 700-pound bluefin tuna after 7-hour fight
item.description: Three teenage fishermen can tell their friends about the big one that didn't get away after fighting for 7 hours to land a huge bluefin tuna earlier this month off the coast of Maine.

item.title: Dutch city cuts ties with Polish twin over 'LGBT-free zone'
item.description: A city in the Netherlands has severed ties with its sister city in Poland after the latter declared itself an "LGBT-free zone."

item.title: Disappearing deep-sea, ultra-black fish mystery solved by scientists
item.description: The Invisible Man isn't the only expert in making himself imperceptible with optics science. Species of ultra-black fish also have that tactic down pat, according to a study published Thursday in the journal Current Biology.

item.title: Great Barrier Reef island, once won in a poker game, is up for sale
item.description: A fully serviced private island in Australia's Southern Great Barrier Reef is now on the market -- just in time for those who want a place to ride out the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Journalist Jemele Hill weighs in on NBA star Kareem Abdul-Jabbar's op-ed
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon talks to journalist Jemele Hill about an op-ed penned by former NBA star Kareem Abdul-Jabbar on anti-semitism in sports and Hollywood.

item.title: 'Magic School Bus' author Joanna Cole dies age 75
item.description: Award-winning US author Joanna Cole, who wrote "The Magic School Bus" series and other children's books, has died at the age of 75.

item.title: Jewelry store buries $1M, wants you to find it
item.description: A Michigan jewelry store has buried approximately one million worth of jewelry throughout the state as it closes due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Elena Delle Donne 'shocked' her WNBA season medical opt-out request was denied, Mystics say she'll be paid
item.description: Elena Delle Donne, the reigning WNBA MVP, wants to play basketball.

item.title: Burger-flipping robot debuts at restaurant
item.description: Flippy, a burger-grilling robot, is now manning grill at a California fast food restaurant, using thermal imaging and 3D optics to sense when to flip and remove hamburger patties.

item.title: Aggressive honey bees at Joshua Tree National Park force multiple campgrounds to close
item.description: Two areas of Joshua Tree National Park are closed after aggressive honey bees forced the park to clear the areas over the past week.

item.title: Cats may have been pets along the Silk Road over 1,000 years ago
item.description: Cats may have been pets for Kazakh pastoralists along the Silk Road over 1,000 years ago, a new study said.

item.title: As India becomes the third nation to reach that grim milestone, it's the poorest that are hardest hit
US reports more than 77,000 new coronavirus cases -- the highest jump so far
item.description: â€¢ UN aid chief: 'Failure to act now will leave the virus free to circle round the globe' â€¢ Florida governor blames the media; CNN anchor rolls the tape â€¢ Hospital owner allegedly faked thousands of Covid-19 tests

item.title: Canada to inessential US travelers: Please stay home
item.description: The Canadian/US border is expected to remain closed for another 30 days, until August 21.

item.title: Trump's outrageous refusal to lead is making the pandemic worse
item.description: â€¢ Analysis: Even Trump knows he is in deep, deep trouble
